goals.question: What is the distribution of population across different zip codes?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the spread of population across different zip codes and identify any outliers or patterns.

goals.question: What is the average income of households in different zip codes?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of income field grouped by zip code
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify the zip codes with higher and lower average income and understand the income distribution across different zip codes.

goals.question: What is the most common type of building in different zip codes?
goals.visualization: Pie chart of building type field grouped by zip code
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the distribution of different types of buildings across different zip codes and identify any patterns or trends.

goals.question: What is the relationship between population and number of businesses in different zip codes?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of population vs number of businesses
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the correlation between population and number of businesses in different zip codes and identify any patterns or trends.

goals.question: What is the distribution of age groups in different zip codes?
goals.visualization: Stacked bar chart of age group field grouped by zip code
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the age distribution across different zip codes and identify any patterns or trends.

code:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    plt.hist(data['population'], bins=20)
    plt.xlabel('Zip Codes')
    plt.ylabel('Population')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of population across different zip codes?')
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    avg_income_by_zip = data.groupby('zip_code')['income'].mean()
    ax = avg_income_by_zip.plot(kind='bar')
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        ax.xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    plt.title("What is the average income of households in different zip codes?")
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    
    building_counts = data.groupby('zip_code')['building_type'].value_counts().unstack().idxmax(axis=1)
    building_counts.plot(kind='pie', autopct='%1.1f%%')
    
    plt.title("What is the most common type of building in different zip codes?", wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    plt.scatter(data['population'], data['number_of_businesses'])
    plt.xlabel('Population')
    plt.ylabel('Number of Businesses')
    plt.title('What is the relationship between population and number of businesses in different zip codes?')
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    
    age_group_zipcode = data.groupby(['zip_code', 'age_group']).size().unstack()
    age_group_zipcode.plot(kind='bar', stacked=True)
    
    plt.title("What is the distribution of age groups in different zip codes?")
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    plt.xlabel("Zip Code")
    plt.ylabel("Number of People")
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()
